author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 7{+t}{+h}century lake that was renovated recently was thrown open for public use here.

The Jetty Kulam and Tirupakulam, both located near Namakkal Fort were renovated at a total cost of Rs. 35 lakh under the MLA Local Area Development Scheme of K.P.P. Baskar.

After renovation works, Tirupakulam was recently opened while work continued in Jetty Kulam.

Besides desilting, strengthening of bunds, beautification works, installing of lights, footpaths and erecting wired fences were done.

The Jetty Kulam was converted into a park with lawn facility.

Minister for Industries and Transport P. Thangamani inaugurated the park in the presence of the MLA and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy here on Saturday night.

The lake served as a place for holy dip for devotees visiting Narasimhar temple and Anjaneyar temple.

However, over the years, due to encroachments and mushrooming of houses in the area, the lake was used as a dumping ground for garbage.

At present, water is stored in the lake and boat service is also introduced.

Both the lakes located on the sides of Narasimhar temple will serve as a place for the public and the devotees to spend their leisure time.

Lights

Visitors to the lake wanted lights to be installed in the fort so that they can enjoy the beauty of the fort during night hours.
title: Renovated lake opened for public use
